thread.title: Ole Miss says Nkemdiche has concussion, will not return
thread.title_full: Ole Miss says Nkemdiche has concussion, will not return

title: Ole Miss says Nkemdiche has concussion, will not return
text:
Updated: 2:59 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 | Posted: 2:59 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 Ole Miss says Nkemdiche has concussion, will not return Related View Larger Mississippi defensive tackle Robert Nkemdiche (5) is checked on by referee Brad Rogers after Nkemdiche was injured on a play against Memphis in the first half of an NCAA college football game Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015, in Memphis, Tenn. (AP Photo/Mark Humphrey) Sponsored Links The Associated Press MEMPHIS, Tenn. â€” 
Mississippi's Robert Nkemdiche will not return to Saturday's game against Memphis after the team says he suffered a concussion in the second quarter. 
The 6-foot-5, 296-pound Nkemdiche, who usually plays defensive tackle, was injured while running the ball in a short-yardage situation. He's been used several times on offense this season and scored three touchdowns. 
Memphis was beating No. 13 Ole Miss 31-14 early in the third quarter. 
___
